body.p: Cover customizations is probably the first customization that you might want to do...

* com.oxygenxml.pdf2.ug/Customization/fo/xsl/front-matter.xsl - Override the default customization to generate a table with one row with two cells. On the left part will be placed the product's logo and in the right part is placed the product's title.

* com.oxygenxml.pdf2.ug/Customization/fo/attrs/layout-masters-attr.xsl - sets a background image for the front page. To implement this we used the background-image property on the fo:region-body associated with the front cover page. To impose a fixed dimension to the background image I've used two Apache FOP extensions: fox:background-image-width and fox:background-image-height.
Declaring additional parameters to the PDF2 transformation

This customization is used to generate three user manual distribution associated with the following products oXygen XML Editor, oXygen XML Author and oXygen XML Developer. Depending on the current published distribution, the logo and background images are different. Therefore, we need an XSLT parameter that points to the current published distribution.

To implement this requirement, I've declared athe oxy-ug-duistribution parameter in the com.oxygenxml.pdf2.ug/Customization/fo/xsl/custom.xsl. To make visible this parameter for the DITA ANT process, we have to declare this parameter in the com.oxygenxml.pdf2.ug/plugin.xml and also to use the dita.conductor.pdf2.param DITA PDF2 extension point.
